name: TrashCat
description:
An educational gaming platform that combines engaging Unity gameplay with research-backed spaced repetition algorithms to build mathematical fluency.

As SVP, I served as both Product Manager and backend developer, designing and implementing the sophisticated learning algorithms that track individual fact mastery through seven sequential learning stages with dynamic difficulty adjustment.

The game follows a cat navigating obstacles home by solving mathematical puzzles, supporting multiplication, addition, subtraction, and division aligned with Common Core standards. Built on AWS serverless architecture with a few hundred active users.

images.description: Main menu showing the cat character, Practice/Speedrun mode selection, and progress bars for four math operations (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication at 22%, Division).

Active gameplay with the cat running through city streets, dodging obstacles (dogs), answering multiplication questions (2 x 10 = ?), with a detailed mastery tracking grid showing progress across different factor groups.
Rewards screen displaying overall progress (22%) with individual multiplication fact families (x0's, x1's, x10's, x5's, x2's) showing Building Speed and Fluency levels with claimable rewards.
